page.title: 03Local History Denchworth
page.content: The name{Denchworth}is probably derived from the owner of the land it was built on,{Daunce,}and{'worth' which means 'homestead'. There is a mediaeval stone cross at the road junction in the village. Another mediaeval cross in the churchyard is used for an annual service to bless crops. Magpie Cottage is made of wattle and daub and is being reconstructed. The Manor House dates from the 12th century, but most of the present building is 17th, 18th and 20th century. Several famous families have owned it, the present owner being Max Aitken, main shareholder of Beaverbrook Papers. An old wool store and wooden thatched barns seen from the road have been revovated. A Cranmer's bible is chained in the church. One of the old brasses dated 1337 is a palimpsest.{
